website_summaries.verdict: An easy-to-use, effective propane radiant heater that can heat a relatively large area of your home.
pros: Can heat a room up to 225 square feet
Handle makes it easy to move from place to place
Two color options – red and gray
Two auto-shutoff functions gives peace of mind
Can be used in tents and other sheltered outdoor spaces as well as indoors
cons: A few reports of faulty units and lack of customer support

customer_reviews.title: Great Heater
customer_reviews.text: It was nice having this heater during my last hunt. It warmed the tent nicely each morning. This allowed me to get dressed in a warm tent without feeling rushed to beat the cold. I ran it off a 20lb propane tank outside the tent and found that I didn't need to run it long to warm the tent.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: On numerous occasions, the control knob became stuck on so that I could not turn it off
customer_reviews.text: On numerous occasions, the control knob became stuck on so that I could not turn it off. This is extremely dangerous and as such I have stopped using it. It does heat up quickly and lasts for a good amount of time, but having the control knob stuck in the on position until the tank runs out is unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Vidal Marcelino

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little heater, must-have for tent camping.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality heater. Read the instructions for use before you put this in an enclosed tent or other enclosed space. Have used several times with complete confidence in the O2 sensor and tip over sensor. Slept several nights with this on full blast, all night long. Great way to stay warm on the scout camping trips with your kids. I've gotten soft in my old age.....
customer_reviews.author: Corbinwaterski

customer_reviews.title: Poor
customer_reviews.text: Very nice heater always use it in our pop up 8 man ice fishing shack and it's works great on low want to dry gloves put it on high for a few min works great!! Also heats this awesome home made ice shack made by my dad! Dog loves the heat! UPDATE: Well thought this was a good heater it only lasted a couple trips and it wouldn’t work again I contacted the company they told me to clean it and blow it out with air! We tried everything and still won’t work. Calling the company again but I’m sure it’s been to long now that they won’t do anything about it
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware!!!
customer_reviews.text: Broke within warranty and the company has horrendous customer service! Heater was nice while it lasted. Wish the company actually cared about following through with the warranty it promises. Buyer Beware!
customer_reviews.author: Young Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Defective Product and maybe design
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to help keep our team warm during soccer games. I used it one game, and it worked fine. The next day it would not stay lit even with just a very small breeze, the temperature was about 40o F. I gave up trying, and put it away until the next game. That day heater would not light at all...the pilot would light, but would not stay on depite how long I held down the knob. I retried it the next day in my garage with no breeze and in a warmer environment. Pilot would not stay lit. Returned the item to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Nieuwendyk-25

customer_reviews.title: Very nice. Homeless man's winter dream.
customer_reviews.text: My dog and I are homeless, and we got one of these in our tent. On the lowest setting, if it is 30f outside, I will have to get up in the middle of the night and turn it off because it gets too warm. For those who wonder, you get about 80hrs of burn time on the lowest setting with a 15lb propane tank. The single 1lb cans give you about 3 1/2hrs.
customer_reviews.author: Ronin Skydancer

customer_reviews.title: Brand new. Looks good. Won't stay lit. Worthless. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for heating a small patio area. I followed instructions (purchase their hose) and connected to propane. The pilot light will light but when you turn the control to "low or "high", the unit will operate for about 30 seconds and then shuts down completely. Once this occurs, if you try to re-light right away, the pilot will light, but the heater will not start up. If you wait a few minutes, the heater will fire up.. but (again) only for about 30 seconds and then it shuts off again. I called and gave up after about 20 minutes on hold. This is a BRAND NEW item. Very disappointing. I'd look to other brands or products.
customer_reviews.author: greg brooks

customer_reviews.title: Its just pretty annoying having to turn it on and off all ...
customer_reviews.text: I would give it more stars. I wish I could. But it just gets so hot. If you need a heater for a larger room this is decent. But we put it in our converted van. We have to turn it off after about 3 minutes because it gets so hot. So we cant use it at night. Its just pretty annoying having to turn it on and off all the time. WE bought the small one too. Same thing with that. I wish they offered an even smaller one. Or a lower setting. But hey at least we have heat.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: I switched the tanks several times and still not good. Looks like a piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Never lit. Couldn't keep the pilot light lit. I switched the tanks several times and still not good. Looks like a piece of junk. I'm sending it back, very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Mavgw

customer_reviews.title: MY BUDDY
customer_reviews.text: This this is amazing! took it camping in Big Bear during winter and the only way we ended up sleeping at all was because we had one of these bad boys. It's a great investment and I can see other uses besides camping gear. I used it inside my tent to keep us warm throughout the night and one propane tank lasted a majority of the night on mediium setting. Not as effective outdoors when your exposed to the elements. Must have for any camper/emergency kit
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: First worked great, second not at all
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these, one after the other. The first worked fine, no trouble. So I bought a second one. This second one would not work. The pilot light would not ignite and stay on even when you pressed the ignition for a long time. Looked like was just getting insufficient gas through to let the pilot light stay on. Would not ignite the burner, either, of course. So big pain, 60 mile trip to nearest UPS drop off to return for me.
customer_reviews.author: ShopperGrrl

customer_reviews.title: No Buddy of mine
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy, so far neither one I received (original purchase and return) WORKED!. For me it's too late (to return) but not for you, do not buy!
customer_reviews.author: T. Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Great heater!!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this heater. I buy the propane refills at Walmart for 3 dollars a piece. This heater made hunting in the cold much more enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Answer to those who don't enjoy cold weather camping.
customer_reviews.text: Heater worked awesome! Only reason I left 4 stars instead of 5 was the same heater is $15 cheaper at Menards. I used the heater in a 9x10 tent, outside temp was down to 20. I left it on until my youngest (7) was asleep, then turned it back on in the morning before he woke up. I would suggest even a small tent fan, ideally one to hang from the ceiling to push the warm air down and keep it circulating.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Morton

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat them
customer_reviews.text: I own a couple of these and you just can't beat them. The small one and the large one both put out great heat. Ive used them in tents and inside home after power outage. I've given some to family members as gifts and they to loved them and were glad they had them. The larger one has a fan built in that runs off of battery or electric(have to buy cord for electric). I'd buy again if ever needed. I use a 12 ft line on the large one and hook it to a 20lb tank.
customer_reviews.author: GCron

customer_reviews.title: Good amount of heat
customer_reviews.text: I use this inside my sprinter van with great results. Remember to crack a window for ventilation or you'll get a whole lot of potentially damaging condensation. Really no different than any other night sleeping as condensation is always an issue, heater or no. We find that running the heater for 20 minutes before bed is plenty to make it warm enough to be comfortable and it's great to run in the mornings while we read and have coffee if it's too cold to be outside. A great investment for the van that's $1200 less than a dedicated diesel heater like the Espar.
customer_reviews.author: C. M.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.text: Most over complicated piece of junk I've ever spent money on. Mine worked for about 8 hours and then it was done. I've taken it apart, cleaned out all the lines and fitting including the pilot oriphus... and nothing. The biggest frustration is the pilot light won't come on and when it does, it won'tstay on. A heater like this doesn't even need a pilot to operate safely but apparently Mr. Heater felt like putting one on anyway. Save yourself the money and headache. DON'T BUY THIS!!! Buy a dyna glo tank top heater instead. Less money, simpler design, and it's purpose built for a 20lb tank. No need for an adapter hose with a fuel filter like this one.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Rausch

customer_reviews.title: Broke after using a few times...
customer_reviews.text: This heater worked great in our airstream a few times, then it stopped working ... it’s nit letting any propane through to light/heat. Worst timing as it was in the middle of a winter snow and we were freezing! Now it is useless
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: We LOVE This Heater!
customer_reviews.text: We're heating a 16' by 16' room we live in during the winter (no way could we heat our 3000 sq/ft home). We use a 5 gal tank which lasts a comfortably long time. There's no smell of gas, it puts out really nice, cozy heat, and we've developed trust in this heater. Our energy bills here in CA were bad and getting worse. We felt we had no control over our gargantuan bills and feared opening the envelopes! No more. We're planning on buying a 2nd Buddy and using a 1 gal. tank for use in the bathroom and kitchen. Light. Portable, Safe, Warm. YUM!
customer_reviews.author: ST9166

customer_reviews.title: Worked great, if want to use 5 bottles.
customer_reviews.text: Bought to use tent camping, did not want to hook up to 20lb. only lasted 5-6 hrs on 1lb on low. high was 3-4. took two full 1lbs to make it through the night and another half in the morning while getting dressed. If you used the big tank, probably should be dedicated to this. Waking up and having to change the tank was so annoying. figured at least make it through the night on low. :\
customer_reviews.author: Darthanian

customer_reviews.title: Great For Covid Dining Outdoor
customer_reviews.text: Now that all the restaurants are dining al fresco only because of covid I needed a heater to keep me warm. Restaurants usually on have one heat lamp if any that don't really keep me warm. This little guy is awesome. I put it in one of my black totes and turn it on under the table and it keeps all of our legs and feet nice and toasty while dining outside in San Francisco chilly evenings. It doesn't come with the 1lb propane tank but all hardware stores carry that in the camping section for $10. Hey all you NYC people you need this too - wished we packed this while on our trip.
customer_reviews.author: Louise, San Francisco, CA

customer_reviews.title: Game changer for camping!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent heater!! Total game changer for camping, you can use the small tanks or buy a hose at Home Depot to connect it to a normal size propane tank, we had a full size tank that was about a quarter full and lasted us all weekend. We’d wake up so warm and cozy we didn’t want to leave the tent and normally we’re up and out to warm up in front of a fire. It’s also completely safe! We set ours on a collapsible side table but if it fell over or anything it will automatically shut off which is relieving to know. This heater is a must have!
customer_reviews.author: Shoppawakka

customer_reviews.title: Heats a small room quickly
customer_reviews.text: Heats up the quilting trailer quickly. I’m using in it a 7x16 custom cargo trailer that has 1” insulation. It’s been below 20F outside for days. The heater brought the trailer to 48 in less than an hour, which isn’t warm enough to work in, but it was faster response than the electric radiator. In this extreme weather a 1-lb propane bottle lasts less than 2 hours. The heater is easy to light, lightweight, and affordable. Your best results are in temps above 20 though—it states this in the paperwork and it’s true. Would I buy again? Yes.
customer_reviews.author: V. WELCH

customer_reviews.title: Safe heat, dependable heat, good construction, not a cheap heater but a worthwhile heater
customer_reviews.text: 69 dollars is a good price (especially when I ordered it during winter) and it kept a 15 x 20 canvas cabin (15 ft high at top arch) into low 50's wihile on low setting (about 4 hours run on one @ 1lb canister disposable propane) while outside in mid to high 30's. appreciated the tilt/fall protection and oxygen protection built into the unit. Left a small condensation puddle under it though - next time put a tray under it.
customer_reviews.author: anotherconsumer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Basecamp or even Car camp
customer_reviews.text: I use this heater after seeing it used by an Overlander. It works great and is efficient with propane. A one pound cylinder lasted about a week, with regular usage in lowish temperatures (20-30 degrees heating either a tent or SUV) The only issue that I have had with it is is that in a smaller space the safety will engage after about 5 minutes of usage unless the area vented almost to where using the heater seems counter intuitive. The way I use the heater is in bursts, and it performs well that way.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Surprising Heat Output!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for our tent to keep it warm when camping in the winter. Haven't used it yet for that purchase, but HAVE been using in in single digit temps to keep the garage above the freezing level while doing some woodworking. Since it's meant for a smaller and more confined space than our garage, we were kinda shocked at how well it has kept the room at a comfortable temp. Can't wait to try it for the purpose it was purchased for...looking forward to some cozy winter camping nights!
customer_reviews.author: C. Auxier

customer_reviews.title: Go to lowes they are only 75 dollars !
customer_reviews.text: Seriously amazon ! If it wasnt such a hassle id return it and buy the same unit for 28 dollars less!
customer_reviews.author: michael morgan

customer_reviews.title: Not a new item received.
customer_reviews.text: Kind of disappointed as I order it for my next camping trip over the weekend. It arrived on time but when I open it to check, I saw there are scratches at the bottom of the product and some minor ones around the front plastic face. This is clearly an used or returned item that I received. I am going to return it. Giving it 1 star not because of the functionality of the product but an used item i received.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for camping in tents
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little heater. Its actually the 2nd one I purchased. I use them mainly for camping in the tents. Put a camp fan in front of it and it blows the heat around nicely. I have spent many dry warm nights in my tent with this heater while others froze and wished they had one. The small green can of propane last for HOURS and I feel safe that it won't explode or catch fire.
customer_reviews.author: amanda geisler

customer_reviews.title: Must have for long hunts
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. It literally saved my life in the Sierra Nevada mountains one time on a hunt when the temperature plummeted to zero and the wind ripped my tent top off. Ive been running it for 5 years now and it's still holding up. Silent and safe. I carry it in my truck every time I go camping. It makes life much more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Jason T McMicken

customer_reviews.title: Good small space heater for inside and camping.
customer_reviews.text: All assembled, only need to hook up gas canister. Operation is fairly simple and straight forward, ignition works good, and immediate heat to about 3 feet out. Since this is a front facing heater, outdoor upto 3 feet was good to feel the heat, inside it took a while but able to heat small bedroom to temp of 70 F in couple hours, so it should heat tent in much quicker speed. When carrying around, it make some noise but then realized this is coming from stabilizer for trip protection so when tilted, it will shut off thus making rattle noise when moving it around.
customer_reviews.author: P. Kim

customer_reviews.title: Only works one season
customer_reviews.text: It should be made out of wood so you can burn it for heat. Would be the same amount of uses. After one season it would not work after running the pilot light. You could empty the fuel burning the pilot, but it will never heat. This is the second one of these with the exact same problem. TRASH WASTE OF MONEY.
customer_reviews.author: Dark Star

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: It's attractive but no heat. It doesn't have a fan so the heat rises up where you can't feel it outdoors. Took it camping to play cards at the table at night. We could only feel it if we stuck it under the table contained in a enclosed area. But that didn't seem safe, the table top became very hot. It's way to big to bring into my tent( maybe 1/2 that size). A lot of money for no heat
customer_reviews.author: SoCal

customer_reviews.title: it worked one time and now I cannot get it ...
customer_reviews.text: it worked one time and now I cannot get it to light. Believe it to be an air lock, but disassembly is practically impossible without breaking something. I have not looked into returning it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Wildwood Cabin

customer_reviews.title: Works really well!
customer_reviews.text: As I can't attest to the safety features because it didn't knock over, it is supposed to turn off if it gets knocked over. I used it in my tent and actually had to turn it off because it worked so well! This was in about 45 degree weather. Zion was forecast at 9-25 degrees at night (even though it didn't happen), I think this would have stood the test had it been that cold.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this heater over the summer in case we needed it for camping. Never needed as the weather was nice. Was getting my ice fishing stuff out and ready and decided to finally try the heater out. Was disappointed to see that the pilot light won’t stay lit no matter how long I hold the knob down. From what I’ve read the thermocouple is bad. Had it to long to return it so I’m stuck trying to fix it. Wish I’d have gone with a cheaper heater that didn’t have all the safety features that go bad.
customer_reviews.author: Drake Chappell

customer_reviews.title: Mr Sardonic itself becomes warm... cold with or without you
customer_reviews.text: "Oh, did you expect me to warm you? ahahaha no." On a windless night in the high desert no matter how we placed Mister Fail in the best of closest huddling conditions there was only a whisper of heat. Full tank of fuel. Tried 3 other full tanks. Camp fires were disallowed in this location. returned. Will not suffer the cold with or without you again. FAIL
customer_reviews.author: 🛡️ veracity 🛡️

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a hose and a filter (the filter is a MUST!!) to convert to use with a bigger propane tank. Works great! I do not like the smell of propane, so I've only been using it in the mornings to take the edge off. So far the coldest it's been (camping) is 38* at night. If the smell does not bother you, this would keep your tent toasty all night.
customer_reviews.author: J S

customer_reviews.title: I love the idea of this heater
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea of this heater, unfortunately, there seems to be durability issues or perhaps build issues. This is my second one and they both have had the same issue. They will not stay lit. It looks like it's a piolet light issue -- after running about 10 minutes or so, it will start to flicker and struggle then will shut off. The gas doesn't continue to run, so it's safe, just not very warm, as you'd imagine. I've taken this one apart and can't seem to identify the issue. Both times I've purchased a new hose as well (the correct filter hose), so I'm pretty confident it's an issue with the heater itself.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great backup heat for inside and out!
customer_reviews.text: Great little heater for inside or out. Demonstrated countless times by countless people showing that it can indeed be used in small enclosed spaces provided oxygen is present. This means campers and RV’s which was my primary purpose. We use these when the power goes out or in the RV if gas runs out of primary tanks at the wrong time. Capable of keeping a bedroom or shed like structure warm enough to do what you need to do. Suggest buying the upgraded hose with 20lb tank adapter for long uses or to save constantly changing and wasting the little camping tanks. Built well as most Mr Heater products are.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart

customer_reviews.title: Very capable little heater!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase, so far. (Obviously, I haven't yet discovered its long-term durability.) It seems well built, solid, safe. Operating the heater is actually pretty simple, despite what on first reading seemed a little complicated. It really just amounts to push-turning to the pilot light setting, pushing down for ignition a couple of times (much as one might with a lighter), then go to the Lo or Hi setting as desired. Gives off plenty of heat for its dimensions and looks appealing.
customer_reviews.author: Randal A. Koene

customer_reviews.title: Mr. Heater F232000 MH9BX Buddy...
customer_reviews.text: This is just about perfect for a small space, or vented tent in very cold weather. It works much, much better with a small battery fan beside it or just above it to blow the heated air towards whatever it is you’re wanting to keep warm or heat. I can definitely understand why the larger unit has the battery powered fan included with it to help push the heated air where needed or wanted. Without it, most of the heated air goes straight up almost immediately after exiting the heater. It still does what I want it to regardless. I’ll sacrifice the size/space and use of fan than purchasing the larger Mr. Heater unit.
customer_reviews.author: chuckntx

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love it. This product has saved me in many camping trips. It warms my tent well. I keep part of the window open to air it out. Ive seen many videos and the Carbon Monoxide arguments are strong on both sides so I still do it just in case. Ive ran the heater all night and ive never had the heater shut off due to too much CM. I will purchase a separate CM detector just in case. Its better to be safe than sorry and I want to be able to sleep having that peace of mind. Ive camped in altitudes of 8500 and ive no issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: Ozzie

customer_reviews.title: The Buddy will shut down at high elevation.
customer_reviews.text: Tested this on a camping trip in Utah's Uinta Mountains, elevation approximately 9,200 feet. It worked outside in the open air without fail, but once inside a ventilated tent, it would kick on for a minute or two and then shut down. I suspect the failure was due to thin air (I've checked out some tests showing the unit emits little or no carbon monoxide [the unit also has a shutoff feature for carbon monoxide]) when fired up in a tent. When operating, the unit was warm-as-a-bag-of-baby-bunnies or hot-as-hell depending on the setting. I'll use it below 7,000 feet, but I'd like to hear suggestions for gas-powered or 200w generator-powered units to heat a tent that operate above 7,000 feet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heating a small camper.
customer_reviews.text: I have a small A-frame pop up camper where I will use this. Remember, with all these propane heater products from any manufacturer one should have a secondary carbon-monoxide detector. I tested this and it works fine. Tip it and it shuts off. It has a high and a low setting. Which is good enough for my purpose. The pilot light lights easily. You can buy a hose to adapt this a BBQ size tank for about $10. It has mounting holes to mount this on a wall.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Evans

customer_reviews.title: Campers, you need this!
customer_reviews.text: Picked this up for our small camper trailer. The large furnace died years ago and runs off the main gas tank. This little fella can warm the camper up FAST using the smaller tanks. It runs so efficiently we don't plan on using it over night, just to take the edge off. Hey, it's a tiny trailer. This way, if there's a leak on a cold night there's only a little bit. Tested it in a workshop twice the size as the trailer and there is an odor of gas when you first fire it up, so I'd recommend starting it up outside and carefully relocating it.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the price!!
customer_reviews.text: THIS KICKS OUT SOME HEAT!!! We initially purchased this item for our camping trips, ended up selling our travel trailer and buying a lake house, BUT it’s been a PERFECT addition to our lake house! We just attach a small propane and set it on the table, and it feels warm instantly! What I love about it is there are different heat settings if you don’t want it too hot. Cons: runs through a small propane pretty quick. Also, don’t let small children around it, it gets very hot and major hazard.
customer_reviews.author: Selene Lariba

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Super happy with this heater. Picked this up because of the great reviews. Warms my 12x12 shed for when I’m working on projects. Temps have been mild lately but shed warms up to 70 on a 35 degree day. I have co detector in shed also and have never had an issue with operating it in my shed. Overall this is a great little heater and serves the purpose I bought it for. I also got the filter and the 12ft hose to run off 20lb tank. The small camping tanks on high you will get about 4-5 hrs roughly
customer_reviews.author: Muzickman

customer_reviews.title: Versatile Heater
customer_reviews.text: With a 1# tank it's portable and handy. With an adapter hose and a 25# tank, it will keep you warm for a long time. I mostly use mine in the tent to keep the edge off at night. Even in my largest family tent, it was very effective even on the lowest setting. Since it has the low O2 safety feature, it is even safe for emergency indoor use (but be careful about leaking propane if you use it indoors. Be sure to read the included instructions completely to avoid any problems!).
customer_reviews.author: Batman97045

customer_reviews.title: One of my 5 must have items in a cold weather emergency
customer_reviews.text: I'm growing a little tired of buying Mr. Buddy! This heater is compact, reasonably priced, can be used in many locations from supplementing your home heating system to camping to ball games/picnics to helping you survive an emergency situation. When people see what Mr. Buddy/Heater can do, they want one. So, I gave one to my sister, then my dad, then my son and then my aunt. I now have 3 I'm trying to hold onto. If you loan one out you might as well realize you didn't loan - you gave because it ain't coming back! I very much love Mr. Buddy and have relied on him through many cold nights.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon  M. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great heater
customer_reviews.text: Am using this as supplemental heat in the house and it works great. I typically run it on low but have used it on high a few times to get the room heated quickly. I have a CO monitor just a few feet away from it and have had absolutely no issues with the monitor going off. Obviously, it has a pilot and therefore an open flame. A little common sense goes a long way for some safety. Assuming you don't have small children to create issues, I highly recommend this if you need some supplemental heat in one room.
customer_reviews.author: Christie

customer_reviews.title: Puts Out Some Heat
customer_reviews.text: Had this in my deer blind (7x7ft) last season, and it kept the blind warm. 35 degrees weather outside, I was hot in the blind. Had to set it back down to low setting. Solid construction. I could see this heater surviving a short fall and not breaking. Very pleased with the quality, and I am certain this little heater will last me for many hunting trips.
customer_reviews.author: Arnold Holan

customer_reviews.title: Bad shipping
customer_reviews.text: When I received it, it was in the box from manufacturer. The box was nearly destroyed. Taped up on top and bottom, in fact it had a large hole in bottom that was taped up. This box should have been in a shipping box. I store my heaters in the original box for the summer. Not this time unless I do a lot more taping. Heater seems to work ok but I only tested it in my shop for a few minutes. When I put it in my deer stand and use it for a day I will ok it then.
customer_reviews.author: balsx

customer_reviews.title: The perfect heater for winter camping
customer_reviews.text: This turned out to be a great heater for warming up our RTT and annex tent. I sleep in the annex with our Aussie and the family is up in the RTT. This little heater warms up both tents and performs well. I leave a window open in the RTT above for any relief of air and I place the Mr. Heater on a solid platform that is heat resistance. We've had this heater keep us warm while camping in winter and the outside temps reaching 25 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Ornelas

customer_reviews.title: Works well, easy to light
customer_reviews.text: I have bought two of these and they work very well and are easy to light, but there seems to be some inconsistency in the low oxygen cut-off level. I am using in my greenhouses for supplemental heat. One heater stays lit all night and works fine, but the other heater shuts off sometime during the night after working a few hours. The only thing I can think would be causing it to shut down is the low oxygen safety sensor. These were purchased a couple years apart and I am not sure if this is the newer one or the older one that is doing that.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: This heater is a lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: I got this to heat my travel trailer since our furnace went out and temps started dipping into the freezing range. It works so well. It is really efficient on propane consumption compared to our old furnace. It warms the place up really quickly and is nice and silent compared to heaters with blower fans in them.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Almost no co2 great for inside the RV in winter
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't sure if I should have gotten the bigger one for my rv but this heats it up in no time. I have used it when it's gotten down to 20f outside and I have had to crank it all the way up to keep it over 65 in the RV. I have a 36' and was worried about co2 poisoning so I put the co2 sensor right on the roof near the heater and it's never gone off. I am glad I got the smaller one and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Mr know it all

customer_reviews.title: It’s great! Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: I like this product! It works great and can sustain operation for hours! I use it winter camping in Michigan. You can also use a paint roller straining rack as sorta makeshift cooking device as it is metal and crooked in a way that can hook in the handle. It’s not recommended by the manufacturer but it is good for making breakfast sandwiches out in your ice shanty. I don’t recommend using this in too small of a space because it gets real hot!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Badger

customer_reviews.title: Garbage! Loose rattling in unit and did not work
customer_reviews.text: Unpacked the box it came in, hooked up fuel line (external fuel tank) with their 10 ft hose, noticed a rattle inside the heater, defective, did not work, tested on a fuel can and two fuel tanks. Its time to make things int he US instead of cheap Chinese trash that just wont work. Then you guys charge us $$ for Chinese garbage? No ty! Id pay more to buy American made! You guys failed my expectations big time.
customer_reviews.author: Marina

customer_reviews.title: the perfect portable heater
customer_reviews.text: Simply put, the perfect portable heater. Out of the box, it was much lighter than I was expecting, but the build is solid (hooray for craftsmanship!) I've used 1 lb and 20 lb propane tanks to fuel it, and it works splendidly. I would highly recommend this for camping. We also have the "big buddy", and while the added fan motor is a plus in some ways, we've found it to be overkill for tent camping. This 1-burner buddy is more than enough, especially considering the small(er) size! (the BIG buddy is just that...)
customer_reviews.author: Derek McCullough

customer_reviews.title: LIFE SAVER!
customer_reviews.text: I was snowboarding in CO for 2 weeks, and i needed a propane heater for the 0 to 20 degree FREEZING nights! Slept like a baby in my underwear with the covers off on low! I dont turn on my heater at my 1700sqft house, and put this in my office (13x15), on low, and im warm and toasty. the 1lb propane is cheap and inexpensive, love this thing! A timer would be nice, but I just throw something at it when im hot!
customer_reviews.author: Jonny

customer_reviews.title: Works good, a little loud
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why but on the low setting it kinda sputters and makes noise. I used it in my deer blind and other than the noise it was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: James Myers

customer_reviews.title: For safety carbon monoxide detector
customer_reviews.text: Mr heater worked wonderful inside of our 4 man tint while camping in Yosemite National Park. Nightly Temperatures were in the low 30s and inside of our tent it was 55-60 degrees, keeping Mr heater in the “low heat“ temperature. I recommend having a carbon monoxide detector / alarm if you’re going to use Mr heater inside a small area ie.. tent. We did have a detector and it did go off twice 3 nights in a row.
customer_reviews.author: james rubio

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I live at 9,000 feet elevation and bought this even though the product description said the unit might "shut off" over 7,000 feet. I brought it to hunting camp at almost 11,000 feet and it worked flawlessly. It ignites on the 3rd click of the igniter every time and kept me warm in my tent. I did not run this all night long. Just long enough in the morning when I woke up to heat the tent up and get dressed and in the evening when I was relaxing before sleep. I love this thing!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I Dislike that it doesn’t work. It wouldn’t let me get it no stars so I had to at least get it 1 to get this to post
customer_reviews.author: duane

customer_reviews.title: Fails too easily due to bad design
customer_reviews.text: fails too easily. there is a pilot light that must remain on or the heater will shut off. it’s a safety feature but the problem is if even a tiny bit of dust gets in the tube or if the propane leaves any residue the the pilot will no longer stay lit properly. To fix you have to clean it out with compressed air. just a bad design.
customer_reviews.author: John C. Kendall

customer_reviews.title: Uodate: working now after repair.
customer_reviews.text: Update. It had a defective thermocouple. They sent me in free and it's working frat now. I'm hoping this thermocouple holds up longer than a month though. Also, from what I hear from others and my experience, their emails always go into the spam bucket. So check there if you don't get a quick response. On the 5th tank, it stopped working. I rarely could keep the pilot on, and even more rare, light the whole unit. I contacted Amazon and their fix was to change the tank. I changed the tank. No difference. Amazon won't take it back. The company I purchased it from will not respond. (found replies in the spam folder)
customer_reviews.author: Cameron R.

customer_reviews.title: Love love this product!
customer_reviews.text: I have been eyeing this product for a while now cause every time I go out camping I’m always freezing at nite and unable to sleep so I did do research at certain stores and amazon had there’s at the cheapest even Walmart was more expensive but all I can say is it’s so worth the money and it kept my rent nice and warm to the point were I had to kick off the blankets! Totally recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: It really worked well. I camped with it in 5degree weather, I probably would have died without it! The first hour of use it smelled like “new metal” being heated. If I had known beforehand I would have let it run outside for an hour or two before I used it in a small tent. I’ve used it a handful of times now and I’m impressed. The temperature inside my winter tent was up to 50 degrees; I had no idea it would be that effective
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for Tent camping.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this heater for a recent camping trip to Grand Tetons Natl. Park. The nights were getting quite cold, and we were able to use this to get some pre-bed warmth and take the chill off. The igniter has worked well and consistently. I am so glad I opted to purchase this. I bought the carrier bag to keep it in and am really happy with that too!
customer_reviews.author: Steve Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Great heater
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd heater. I purchased the first one at least 10 years ago and it finally quit. Use it during power outages or just for a little extra warmth. If you are going to use it hooked to a larger tank using rubber hose, I suggest purchasing the filter. That's probably what clogged my old one. New on/off dial has spark mechanism built-in. Great heater with safety features for warmth, safely when needed.
customer_reviews.author: D. Wells

customer_reviews.title: I used ut once and it worked great. We gave a blizzard coming tonight into tomorrow ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a little over a year ago. I used ut once and it worked great. We gave a blizzard coming tonight into tomorrow and i figured id test my heater to see if it worked, nope! Thing does not work at all. Pilot doesnt stay lit. I took it apart, cleaned out all the tubes and put it back together, now nothing works. POS.
customer_reviews.author: Conor Phalen

customer_reviews.title: GARBAGE!!!!!!! THROW IN THE TRASH  AND BUY A NEW ONE EVERY SEASON
customer_reviews.text: These things are junk. They last maybe 10-15lbs of propane then the problems start. They make it nearly impossible to service as the whole unit needs to be disassembled to get to anything. The positive reviews must be from people who used the thin for a week.
customer_reviews.author: T. Sommers

customer_reviews.title: Nice little unit
customer_reviews.text: I use it to defrost an old work truck that dosnt have a heater. I leave it running in the cab for about 20mins and it melts all the frost off and heats the cab up pretty good. Also I move it around and aim it at my hands when I’m doing maintenance on equipment outside in the winter. I Move quicker than the guys that don’t have one.
customer_reviews.author: Forrest Tree

customer_reviews.title: You don't need the fan in a space like a cargo trailer
customer_reviews.text: Received it yesterday. Put it in my 6x12 Cargo Camping trailer and turned her on. I couldn't believe how warm this thing was. You don't need the fan in a space like a cargo trailer. The Heat rises up and if you place your hand 12 inches above the heater....it feels like you may get burned the air is so hot. There is no heat on the sides, bottom or back ...so clearance is not an issue as long as you don't place underneath something. I'm happy with it and am very glad I didn't get the big buddy at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Life saver on those cold camping nights
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this recently and used it the next weekend. Temps got into the low 40's, I ran the heater on low in a small 2 person tent and it did a great job of keeping the chill out. I would suggest buying the hose and adapter to run to a full size tank though. I learned this the hard way the first night after waking up at 3am and having to change the small fine thread bottle while still half asleep and cold. FYI I was getting about 3 1/2 to 4 hrs run time on the low setting for a 16oz bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Brett A.

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids' sports!
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this because our winter is never ending and I have to sit at baseball games in the evening. I have used it in the dugout, the score box, and in the stands. It heats nicely especially in enclosed spaces. It can sometimes be hard to get the pilot to stay lit and the heater to continue heating but I think that might be operator error. Over all I really like this heater and will be using it for many winters the come because it's just so handy!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Cahill

customer_reviews.title: Does heats as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I had this in my tent in 20 degree weather. Since I was worried about CO poisoning I had windows open all around the tent for fresh air and a fan to move around the air. To test the safety feature I tilted the heater and it turned off as it should. Each 1lbs tank lasted about 4 hours. I was very comfortable sleeping. I will say be careful because it seemed like there was a gas buildup at the top of the tent. The small fan I had disapate the gas a little. Overall it's a very good product.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett H.

customer_reviews.title: Small and mighty - great for camping or where you want heat
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews about this before buying. I bought it to heat an RV in place of the heater that is noisy all night. I could also see this as a good heater for something like a tent. It does turn off if tipped over but remains hot until it olls off. This would also be a good ice fishing heater.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Great heater real good heat out put
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these heaters they arrived perfect no dents r anything bent r missing. Puts out alot of heat and easy to use. Both r working great so far now I'm ready for winter. Great heater will buy again later. Comes with the information book on the heater. Heater is made pretty strong. Looks like it's built to last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Cool Richard

customer_reviews.title: Power outage for 4 days!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: My parents are over their 75 years . They will be safe and warm now. My mom can handle this with very easy functions. Great for camping in a spare bedroom pretty much any place. Father likes to tinker around in garage. I could not afford the largest one. But this will work great. Buy Buy great product.
customer_reviews.author: T JJ

customer_reviews.title: Great heater! Gets hot fast!
customer_reviews.text: Was a little hesitant on buying this heater because I had the little buddy before and was very disappointed with that one. But this heater is so great I can’t believe it’s made by the same company as the little buddy! Seems very durable and it gets hot fast! Had it in my little 2 person tent when out in the desert and only used it on low for a couple minutes at a time because it heats my tent right up! I do recommend getting the hose and a 20lb propane tank because it does go through the 1lb tanks pretty fast!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Brooks Lorenz

customer_reviews.title: Great little heater
customer_reviews.text: Great little heater! In a 9 1/2 foot slide in truck camper the lower 4000 BTU setting is too much for it to run all night (with window very slightly cracked for ventilation!) in 20F outside temps. The 9000 BTU setting will warm it up in the camper really quick. Purchased with the "Mr. Heater 75,000 BTU 12-Foot Propane Hose" and "Mr. Heater Fuel Filter for Portable Buddy" to run off of a 20 lb cylinder (std BBQ Grille size).
customer_reviews.author: Presto

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Tent Heater
customer_reviews.text: I have a 12X12 canvas pyramid tent. One butane canister keeps the tent warm for about 5-6 hours on low setting and heats the tent to a comfortable temperature. However, I do not camp in below-freezing weather so I don't know how it fares in very cold weather. I'm very happy with how small but effective this thing is. Clean-burning, little or no smell, easy to use, and dependable.
customer_reviews.author: Nathanael

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and effective
customer_reviews.text: Works great. heated up my van in no time and kept it warm using less than 3 ounces of propane. Note pilot light is a little tricky, mine took several clicks to catch and it is not very adjustable (only choices are high and low and even the low is pretty high). But overall it is functional and well made, for a good price, just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: bilco

customer_reviews.title: in door safe camp heater
customer_reviews.text: super awesome for our camping trailer! shucks, the wife is saying this might be too hot! that's okay!! A re review 3-9-2019. This thing really puts out some heat! The really amazing thing is that this safe for indoors!!!!!! I am actually using it in my front room right now on the high setting as it is cold out ,low 30's. I feel that that this really works well! I highly recommend this product!!
customer_reviews.author: toddzilla

customer_reviews.title: gets very very hot. hooked up to 20# tank ...
customer_reviews.text: gets very very hot. hooked up to 20# tank with a fuel filter and it runs no problem. Flame does go out when it tips over. The surrounding metal gets very hot and it burned a blanket. Completely my fault, but make sure you dont fall asleep with it on around you and clear space in front of the unit. Heats a 31 foot adequately and quickly. Up to 110 hours of heating if run on low with 20# tank. I'd buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Liverpooligan

customer_reviews.title: Good enough
customer_reviews.text: Got it the other day. Haven't tried it out in cold weather yet, but it heated up my kitchen quite fast. Packaging was wack. Why even waste the paper stuffing? *Update*Gone camping with it twice, awesome. Kept me nice and warm, but it does hog up propane tanks like nobody's business.
customer_reviews.author: GeBingBing

customer_reviews.title: Was worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: We used this heater while tent camping in 20 degree temps. The first night we kept it in a low setting being that our tent is not that big, an 8 person tent. In the low setting we were way to cold to even get out from under the sleeping bags to change the propane canister when it ran out, about 5 hours. The second night we put it on high which required us to change the canister about every 3 hours. The tent was more than warm, even to the point of the dig moving as far away from it as possible. Would be nice to have a medium setting.
customer_reviews.author: Christina M Clark

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little heater! Must have for cold days!
customer_reviews.text: We wish we would have bought this earlier, 1 pound propane bottles are cheap, this little thing puts off tons of heat for a long time and once you get it lit, only takes 32 seconds , you will start feeling very warm as long as your not in direct wind. I definitely recommend buying it, auto shut off if it rips and pilot light so you won’t have a CO issue.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Great little heater!
customer_reviews.text: We have this as our heat in our 25 ft C class RV. It kept us warm and toasty on the low setting in 27 degree weather the other night. Installed a propane line to hook it to a 20 gallon outside tank. Be mindful of placement it needs plenty of clearance above and in front and keep a window cracked for venting as with any propane appliance.
customer_reviews.author: Tamara Giacomozzi

customer_reviews.title: Works great in RV
customer_reviews.text: Even after watching several videos on how to properly start it, it works great. My son is using in his RV with a 20lb propane tank. I've read that the 1lb tank lasts about 4 hours on low, but that never happened. 2 hours was the best he got. Very safe. Purchased with a carbon monoxide detector.
customer_reviews.author: Donna L. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: We have used this in the camp trailer to avoid using batteries to run the furnace. Wife uses it on the patio on cool evenings when we sit out and enjoy the evening. Very happy with it. I bought the Flame King 1lb refillable tanks to go with it to avoid the cost and waste of the throw away tanks. The tanks are easy to fill and use.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Excellent little heater
customer_reviews.text: Excellent little heater. I used 2 of these to heat a 1200sq ft ranch for 4 days during a power outage. Mini propane tank will last as long as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Stewman1

customer_reviews.title: Kill the chill in your tent or trailer
customer_reviews.text: Useful for group camping trips in any weather. You can kill the chill of each tent by running it a few minutes, to make going to bed and getting up much more comfortable. We camp with a pop-up trailer sometimes and this set low is plenty, or outside around the camp table it can warm all our feet at once. Indoor safe, tip safe, CO safe. I had a different one which had a bad smell for the first many hours, but that's not a problem with these.
customer_reviews.author: David G Carter

customer_reviews.title: Kept my family nice and warm in below 50F camping weather
customer_reviews.text: This little guy kept me warm, probably a little too warm. I used it with the mr heater propane tank hose accessory and my own full size tank. It lasted me 3 nights, 8-10 hrs a night without running out of fuel. I used it on low because my tent was slanted and the ceiling near the heater heater up a bit too much for my liking. I thought the high setting would burn a hole or set us on fire. I used a infrared thermometer to make sure it wasn’t getting out of control. Will definitely use again and would replace it with the same unit if lost or broken.
customer_reviews.author: triton

customer_reviews.title: I’ve used other types of heaters and this one is by far the best. I have used it all hunting season in ...
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the money. I’ve used other types of heaters and this one is by far the best. I have used it all hunting season in a small cabin with no heat and had no issues with using it indoors. If you have extreme cold and a larger space I would get the larger one and get the hose for the 20lb bottle. The one pond bottle will last about five hours on low.
customer_reviews.author: reeac

customer_reviews.title: 5 Star Review
customer_reviews.text: I write this review as I'm sitting in a hunting blind at 10 degrees. I *love* this heater. It's easy to carry and is very sturdy. It takes a small propane tank. I'd estimate that a tank lasts for 4 hrs. You can get them any place that sells outdoor gear or a hardware store.
customer_reviews.author: Julie F

customer_reviews.title: It does the job
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my neighbors because they couldn't afford to pay the heating bill during the winter, they also have animals to take care of, so far they told me it works! Keeps a nice bit of their house warm! That's as good enough of a review I could make! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Jaki Muth

product_meta.title: Mr. Heater F232000 MH9BX Buddy 4,000-9,000-BTU Indoor-Safe Portable Propane Radiant Heater, Red-Black
product_meta.description: Color:Red| Style Name:HeaterNorth America's Most Popular Portable Propane Heater! This patented radiant 4,000-9,000 BTU Liquid Propane heater connects directly to a 1 lb. cylinder and is the perfect solution for heating enclosed spaces like large tents up to 200 sq. ft. The expertly engineered size to BTU ratio is augmented with a fold down handle to give this heater maximum output while retaining a minimalistic footprint. A swivel regulator gives you the ability to adapt usage from a disposable cylinder to a remote gas supply with the purchase of a hose and filter. To light the unit, simply rotate the knob to pilot and push. Then the integrated Piezo sparking mechanism will take care of the rest. With the Oxygen Depletion Sensor (ODS) and accidental tip-over safety shut-off you can be sure that you will enjoy years of comfortable indoor safe heat.*WE ARE NOT ABLE TO SELL THIS PRODUCT TO CANADA AND MASSACHUSETTS* **Please note when operating the heater at altitudes over 7,000 FT above sea level the heater may shut off.
